Upps; forgot to say that the problem was seen in 3.2M4.
Note: in the future JDT Text will give the user the choice whether to disable the failing completion participant.

I don't find a test case to reproduce the bug.

Tom - Do you recognize the performed action from the stacktrace ?

From the trace I can only tell that it was not "Content Assist" that was invoked, but "Show Context Information" (Ctrl+Shift+Space by default). This operation shows  the parameter definitions when within a method call.

This is currently implemented in jdt.ui by getting the normal method proposals at an offset prior to the opening parenthesis where the caret resides.

Not sure whether this helps here.

This is correct. I'm working on another plugin (for a proprietary language) and was studying how content-assist and context-information are working.

I could not reproducre the error then or later.
As nobody can reproduce it, i close this bug as WORKSFORME.
